website_summaries.verdict: Despite the low price, this is a reliable pair of bindings that is likely to last through several seasons.
pros: Easy-to-use design that can accommodate a wide range of boot sizes
Snug fit with straps that adjust easily
The simple design goes well with almost any pair of boots
cons: The materials are not as durable as other bindings, but this is to be expected for the price

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price and value
customer_reviews.text: I am an intermediate level snowboarder that purchased these bindings as a quick/inexpensive replacement. The bindings performed flawlessly on packed powder and blue/black runs. I am thoroughly impressed with the ease of entry and exit of these bindings. I am strongly considering buying these same bindings for my son. Excellent price and value!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan D.

customer_reviews.title: Great value, high quality
customer_reviews.text: These bindings are great! Comfortable with a smooth and solid design that can easily match bindings priced double what these are,the bindings are a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: its a okay product ,but hard to untighten, over all love it amazing to use in winter. 5 STARS
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great 1st Binding for my 12 year old who has big feet or anyone who is not a pro rider
customer_reviews.text: Very Deluxe Binding for the $ -great value - beginner to advanced riders. thank you 5th Element Great Binding
customer_reviews.author: tim driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These bindings are so easy for my 10 year old to use. He loves them.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dixon

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Used them for two days of boarding
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Used them for two days of boarding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value for price.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful bindings. Fit perfect with my size 13 DC boots. Comfy and secure also.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Nice bindings by a known company
customer_reviews.text: Best bindings I could find that were inexpensive and by a company I've heard of. They worked great, tight and adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Richards

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for 5 days at Keystone, there were no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Igor Iurchuk

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Bindings
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my boyfriend's first snowboard and he loved it. He's a size 10/10.5 for shoes and the bindings fit perfectly. The pads help with comfort and the quality is great for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Ina Jung

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Work great feel great and even fit size 13 boots
customer_reviews.author: Terry gardner

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 5th use
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for like 4 days on the mountain, then my rear foot strap broke
customer_reviews.author: james hilton

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy and I cant get it adjusted just right. It works but my feet were sore after a day.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey J.

customer_reviews.title: Great freestyle bindings! Perfect for park!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these last season for a cheap board and they perform as well as I could ever ask. Perfect for the park, flex is good and they are super comfortable and adjustable. Would definitely recommend. One downside is the mounting hardware loosened up after a season but a drop of Locktite solved that problem. Still 10/10!
customer_reviews.author: Sam Banks

customer_reviews.title: Good bindings, good price.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these bindings for about 3 seasons now and they are finally starting to wear down. All in all, they are extremely reliable, a good price, and get the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Austyn

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: For the price point, they're good bindings. I've used them for 4 different snowboarding trips and they've continued to perform well. Great for a beginner/intermediate boarder not looking to break the bank for their first set of gear.
customer_reviews.author: Conan

product_meta.title: 5th Element Stealth 3 Convertible Strap Snowboard Bindings Black
product_meta.description:
The Stealth 3 from 5th Element is a great economical binding for the newer or less experienced snowboarder who is looking for performance and value. The convertible toe straps will keep your foot locked down, give you great control over your board, and will conform to any boot toe shape. The Stealth 3 has a padded base plate to reduce vibrations as you learn to progress and pick up speed. The forward lean adjustment will help you get your stance dialed in just right. If you want a binding that will have a great value the 5th Element Stealth 3 is for you.

Specifications:
Snowboard Best Use: All-Mountain Freestyle
Strap Material: Soft Flexing Durable Covered Foam Strap
Flex: Very Soft
HighBack: Plastic
Buckles: Plastic
Toe Strap Style: Convertible
Warranty: One Year
Quick Entry: No
Canted Footbed: No
Chassis Material: Plastic
Binding Compatibility: Standard 4 Hole
Snowboard Binding Padding: Basic
Skill Range: Beginner - Advanced Intermediate

Product ID: 368998
Gender: Mens
Skill Level: Beginner
Model Number: 11PH03-61280005
feature_bullets: Performance Bindings on a Budget - The Stealth 3 is an economical choice for riders of all levels who don't want to burn a hole in their pocket.
Locked-In Control - The binding's convertible toe strap conforms seamlessly to any boot shape for full control over your board.
Smooth and Steady Ride - A padded base plate helps reduce vibrations and chatter so your ride is stable and effortless, even at high speeds.
Find Your Stance On the Go - The single component highback features a forward-lean adjuster that can easily be changed on the fly.
Flex That Doesn't Fight - The Stealth 3 bindings have a very soft level of flex that will help riders progress, and are a favorite of freestyle riders.
